intro: Glycosmis greenei var. cymosa, commonly known as the clustered sweetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy green leaves. It produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible but not widely cultivated. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
